acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Stephanie Blumenthal, daughter of Fritz Blumenthal, in 2003.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Fritz Blumenthal came to the U.S. in 1938 after having received his Doctor of Medicine degree in 1937 from the University of Bern, Switzerland. Although Blumenthal remained a practicing physician, he continued to write poetry, paint and produce prints and his work was exhibited throughout the U.S. and Europe during his lifetime.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains family and personal documents, correspondence, 1930-1996, clippings, manuscripts of poetry, sketchbooks, correspondence and clippings concerning exhibitions of Fritz Blumenthal's art (water colors and monotypes), materials and correspondence on radioactive fallout from the 1950s and 1960s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
